Modification_Detail.description:
This version of the Display dictionary, 1.1.0.0, is built against version 1.1.0.1 of the PDS4 common model. This version of the dictionary is NOT backwards compatible with the previous version. The following updates have been made:
1) A super class, named Display_Settings, has been added. It is intended as a container for all the display related classes within the Discipline_Area of a label.
2) The local_identifier_reference attribute has been replaced with a Local_Internal_Reference class. It has been pulled out of the Default_Display_Settings_* classes and promoted up to the Display_Settings class.
3) The Default_Display_Settings class has been renamed to Display_Direction. It's description has been updated to reflect that the directional attributes are not suggestions but instructions on the correct display of an image.
4) The Default_Display_Settings_Color, Default_Display_Settings_Movie, and Default_Display_Settings_Color_Movie classes have been replaced by the Color_Display_Settings and Movie_Display_Settings classes. The latter are no longer extensions of another class but stand alone on their own. Each contains only those attributes related to color or video content, respectively. One or more of these classes may be used to describe a digital Array object, as needed.
5) Four enumerated values changed in version 1.1 have been changed back to (roughly) their 1.0 values:
Right --> Left to Right Left --> Right to Left Down --> Top to Bottom Up --> Bottom to Top
Corresponding changes were made to the min_chars and max_chars values of the attributes.
6) The extraneous conditional portion of some test statements in the Schematron file has been removed.
7) The included project file has been re-configured to automatically load the XML catalog file.

This version of the Display dictionary, v1.0.0.4, makes a number of changes:
1) It updates the descriptions of the dictionary and its classes to make it clearer that the included attributes describe display parameters only, and are not to be presumed to be scientifically accurate.
2) It attempts, unsuccessfully, to utilize the PDS common "comment" attribute, rather than recreating that attribute in the local namespace, as was done in the previous version. Further work will have to be required to get this to work properly.
3) With the exception of the boolean "true" and "false" values, all enumerated values have been changed from lower case to "Title" case, in accordance with CCB-22, "Adopt Rules for Case of Enumerated Values".
4) Four enumerated values have been changed:
Left_to_Right --> Right Right_to_Left --> Left Top_to_Bottom --> Down Bottom_to_Top --> Up
Corresponding changes were made to the min_chars and max_chars values of the attributes.
5) A spelling mistake in the definitions of the red_, green_, and blue_channel_bands has been corrected: "deafult" --> "default".

This version of the Display dictionary, v1.0.0.3, was released to the DDWG for review, before distribution to a broader community. It includes the Default_Display_Settings class and three subclasses to handle color images, movies, and color movies.
